perturbation.original_text:
9.2
Restrictions and Covenants. Except as otherwise provided herein, each Party agrees that, in its capacity as the Recipient of
Confidential Information, it will (i) hold the Discloser’s Confidential Information in strict confidence, use a high degree of care
in safeguarding the Discloser’s Confidential Information, and take all precautions necessary to protect the Discloser’s
Confidential Information including, at a minimum, all precautions the Recipient normally employs with respect to its own
Confidential Information, (ii) not divulge any of the Discloser’s Confidential Information or any information derived therefrom
to any other person (except as set forth in Section 9.3 hereof), (iii) not make any use whatsoever at any time of the Discloser’s
Confidential Information except as is necessary in the performance of Recipient’s specific duties under this Agreement, (iv)
not copy, reverse engineer, alter, modify, break down, melt down, disassemble or transmit any of the Discloser’s Confidential
Information, (v) not, within the meaning of United States or other export control laws or regulations, export or re-export,
directly or indirectly, including but not limited to export on the Internet or other network service, any of the Discloser’s
Confidential Information, (vi) notify the Discloser in writing immediately upon discovery by the Recipient or its
Representatives of any unauthorized use or disclosure of the Discloser’s Confidential Information, and (vii) upon the
termination or expiration of this Agreement, immediately return to the Discloser or destroy (at the option of the Recipient) all
such Confidential Information, including all originals and copies.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.2
Restrictions and Covenants. Except as otherwise provided herein, each Party agrees that, in its capacity as the Recipient of
Confidential Information, it will (i) endeavor to hold the Discloser’s Confidential Information in confidence, and use reasonable care
in safeguarding the Discloser’s Confidential Information, and take reasonable precautions to protect the Discloser’s
Confidential Information, (ii) may divulge the Discloser’s Confidential Information or any information derived therefrom
to any other person, (iii) may make use at any time of the Discloser’s
Confidential Information regardless if it is necessary in the performance of Recipient’s specific duties under this Agreement, (iv)
may copy, reverse engineer, alter, modify, break down, melt down, disassemble or transmit any of the Discloser’s Confidential
Information, (v) may, within the meaning of United States or other export control laws or regulations, export or re-export,
directly or indirectly, including but not limited to export on the Internet or other network service, any of the Discloser’s
Confidential Information, (vi) notify the Discloser in writing at a delayed time upon discovery by the Recipient or its
Representatives of any unauthorized use or disclosure of the Discloser’s Confidential Information, and (vii) upon the
termination or expiration of this Agreement, will not return to the Discloser nor destroy (at the option of the Recipient) all
such Confidential Information, including all originals and copies.
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces conflicting definitions regarding the handling of confidential information. The original text mandates strict confidentiality, prohibiting disclosure and use of confidential information except for specific duties. The modified text contradicts this by allowing potential disclosure, unrestricted use, and the option not to return or destroy confidential information. This creates uncertainty regarding the recipient's obligations concerning confidential data, potentially leading to legal disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
3.13
Eutectix Warranty. Eutectix warrants that the Product (i) will conform to the Specifications, (ii) will be free from manufacturing
defects (including all defects in workmanship and any defects in materials that were not specified by Liquidmetal or
Customer), ) will be free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, charges, claims, or adverse interests of any kind, (iii) will comply
with, in all stages of manufacture and distribution to Liquidmetal or Customer, the terms of Section 10. The foregoing
representations and warranties shall survive delivery, inspection and payment and shall run in favor of Liquidmetal and its
Affiliates, and their respective successors, assigns and customers, both direct and indirect.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.13
Eutectix may take effort to warrants that the Product (i) will possibly conform to the Specifications, (ii) may be free from manufacturing
defects (including all defects in workmanship and any defects in materials that were not specified by Liquidmetal or
Customer), ) will possibly be free and clear of all liens, encumbrances, charges, claims, or adverse interests of any kind, (iii) will attempt to comply
with, in all stages of manufacture and distribution to Liquidmetal or Customer, the terms of Section 10. The foregoing
representations and warranties may or may not survive delivery, inspection and payment and shall not run in favor of Liquidmetal and its
Affiliates, and their respective successors, assigns and customers, both direct and indirect.
perturbation.explanation: Original text is a warranty meaning that it HAS to follow the specification, but the modified text changes the liability into 'may or may not'. The introduction of these two makes for an uncertain agreement, as it is up to interpretation of the definition. A court may not see it as a warranty, which originally meant that Eutectix needed to comply with the specs provided.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1
Termination for Cause. Either Party may terminate this Agreement hereunder for default if the other Party materially breaches
this Agreement; provided, however, no termination right shall accrue until thirty (30) days after the defaulting Party is notified
in writing of the material breach and has failed to cure within the thirty (30) day period after notice of a material breach.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1
Termination for Cause. Either Party may terminate this Agreement hereunder for default if the other Party materially breaches
this Agreement; provided, however, no termination right shall accrue until thirty (30) days after the defaulting Party is notified
in writing of the material breach and has failed to cure within a reasonable time period after notice of a material breach.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifically defines a '30 day' cure period, but in the modified, it gives the right to 'a reasonable time period'. This makes the contract ambiguous due to the undefined timeframe and lack of accountability to cure the error. Reasonable is an adjective meaning that it is subjective to each party.
